intro: Chionographis sparsa, commonly known as the snowgrass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions. It thrives in harsh environments with cold temperatures and poor soil conditions. The plant has a rosette structure, with dense, silvery-white leaves that help reflect sunlight and reduce water loss. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically green or white, appearing in early spring. Chionographis sparsa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms in its native habitats.
